results.title: How Much Would Trump’s Coronavirus Treatment Cost Most Americans?
results.abstract: Even for those with insurance, surprise bills for things not covered can add up fast.
des_facet: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

multimedia.caption: President Trump’s physician Dr. Sean Conley, with other medical staff members, briefing reporters outside Walter Reed National Military Medical Center on Saturday. While Mr. Trump did not have to worry about the costs of his care, many Americans who have been ill with Covid-19 face large medical bills.
multimedia.copyright: Anna Moneymaker for The New York Times

results.title: Distrust of China Jumps to New Highs in Democratic Nations
results.abstract: The sharpest rise in negative views was in Australia, while unfavorable opinions jumped in the United States and Europe, a Pew survey found.

multimedia.caption: In many Western countries, public distrust of China and its leader, Xi Jinping, has soared in the past year.

results.title: For Parents, a New Level of Big-Picture Anxiety
results.abstract: Beneath the mantle of acute apprehension burns a molten core of profound, long-term worry.

results.title: After Meat Workers Die of Covid-19, Families Fight for Compensation
results.abstract: Employees of a JBS meat-processing plant in Greeley, Colo., got sick or died, but their families have so far been denied compensation.
org_facet: United Food and Commercial Workers Union

results.title: It’s Not Only Women Who Want More Intimacy in Relationships
results.abstract: Contrary to prevailing gender tropes, many men crave deeper emotional connection, work hard for it and don’t always receive it in return.

results.title: What All That Touch Deprivation Is Doing to Us
results.abstract: It’s going to be a while before we can hug freely again. What does that mean for our mental health?

results.title: Aging and Ailing Lab Chimps Are Still at Center of Fight for Sanctuary
results.abstract: Activists and some congressional lawmakers are demanding that the N.I.H. reconsider its refusal to move 39 chimpanzees from a research center to a sanctuary.

multimedia.caption: Danielle, Tosha and Nope — all retired from biomedical research — at the Chimp Haven sanctuary in Keithville, La., in April.

results.title: What We Dream When We Dream About Covid-19
results.abstract: Several recent studies shed light on the pandemic preoccupations of sleepers.

results.title: White House Blocks New Coronavirus Vaccine Guidelines
results.abstract: The F.D.A. proposed stricter guidelines for emergency approval of a coronavirus vaccine, but the White House chief of staff objected to provisions that would push approval past Election Day.
results.byline: By Sharon LaFraniere and Noah Weiland

results.title: White House Is Not Tracing Contacts for ‘Super-Spreader’ Rose Garden Event
results.abstract: Since President Trump’s Covid diagnosis, numerous associates have tested positive, but the White House has not aggressively investigated the outbreak.
results.byline: By Apoorva Mandavilli and Tracey Tully
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

multimedia.caption: Despite being linked to seven coronavirus infections, the White House is not tracing contacts of those who attended the celebration for Judge Amy Coney Barrett on Sept. 26.

results.title: Nearly One-Third of Covid-19 Patients in Study Had Altered Mental State
results.abstract: The hospitalized patients showed signs of deteriorating neurological function, ranging from confusion to coma-like unresponsiveness, new research indicates.

multimedia.caption: A study of hospitalized Covid-19 patients in the Chicago area showed that nearly a third of those patients had some form of altered mental ability.

results.title: Carter Williams, Who Unshackled Nursing Home Residents, Dies at 97
results.abstract: By closely describing the inner lives of older people, Ms. Williams altered legal regulations and clinical standards applied to nursing homes.

results.title: Parents Face Murder Charge in Death of Girl With Severe Lice
results.abstract: Some experts were skeptical that lice alone could have killed the girl, Kaitlyn Yozviak. The case underscored fears about how the pandemic has cut children off from people who could report neglect.

results.title: Nobel Prize in Medicine Awarded to Scientists Who Discovered Hepatitis C Virus
results.abstract: Harvey J. Alter, Michael Houghton and Charles M. Rice were jointly honored for their decisive contribution to the fight against blood-borne hepatitis, a major global health problem.
results.byline: By Katherine J. Wu and Daniel Victor

results.title: A New Film Looks at an Orchestra for People With Mental Illness
results.abstract: Music “gets the cognitive part out of the way and gets the intuitive part engaged, the part of the brain that is not damaged,” one therapist says.

results.title: Instead of Reassurance, Trump’s Doctor Delivers Confusion, Experts Say

results.title: Can Halloween Be Saved? Yes, Experts Say. Here’s How.
results.abstract: You can still safely celebrate the ghoulish season, but trick-or-treating and other celebrations may have to be modified to protect against coronavirus infection.

results.title: For Trump, the Only Medical News Is Good Medical News
results.abstract: Conflicting accounts of the president’s condition underline the fact that the public does not have a definitive answer about the president’s health.

results.title: Trump’s Covid Treatments Are Aimed at Preventing Severe Illness
results.abstract: Outside experts pointed to the therapies as signs that the president’s health may not be as good as his doctors said. His age, weight and gender put him at high risk.
